ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description: PoreSpy is a collection of image analysis tool used to extract information from 3D images of porous materials (typically obtained from X-ray tomography). There are many packages that offer generalized image analysis tools (i.e Skimage and Scipy.NDimage in the Python environment, ImageJ, MatLab's Image Processing Toolbox), but the all require building up complex scripts or macros to accomplish tasks of specific use to porous media. The aim of PoreSpy is to provide a set of pre-written tools for all the common porous media measurements.
about.summary: A set of tools for characterizing and analying 3D images of porous materials

name: porespy

about.description: PoreSpy is a collection of image analysis tool used to extract information from 3D images of porous materials (typically obtained from X-ray tomography). There are many packages that offer generalized image analysis tools (i.e Skimage and Scipy.NDimage in the Python environment, ImageJ, MatLab's Image Processing Toolbox), but the all require building up complex scripts or macros to accomplish tasks of specific use to porous media. raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "porespy" %}
{% set version = "3.0.3" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 4bc86cbd5ba37bcacc5624e54ee9c245299b0764fd68bed8beb9d8d94753f97b

build:
  number: 2
  skip: true  # [py<311]
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  build:
    - python                                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}     # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - pip
    - python
    - hatchling
  run:
    - dask
    - deprecated
    - edt
    - matplotlib-base
    - numba
    - numpy
    - openpnm
    - pandas
    - psutil
    - rich
    - python
    - scikit-image
    - scipy
    - setuptools
    - tqdm
    - pywavelets

test:
  imports:
    - porespy

about:
  home: https://github.com/PMEAL/porespy/
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: A set of tools for characterizing and analying 3D images of porous materials
  description: PoreSpy is a collection of image analysis tool used to extract information from 3D images of porous materials (typically obtained from X-ray tomography). There are many packages that offer generalized image analysis tools (i.e Skimage and Scipy.NDimage in the Python environment, ImageJ, MatLab's Image Processing
    Toolbox), but the all require building up complex scripts or macros to accomplish tasks of specific use to porous media. The aim of PoreSpy is to provide a set of pre-written tools for all the common porous media measurements.

  doc_url: https://porespy.org/
  dev_url: https://github.com/PMEAL/porespy/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jgostick
    - ma-sadeghi

about.description: PoreSpy is a collection of image analysis tool used to extract information from 3D images of porous materials (typically obtained from X-ray tomography). There are many packages that offer generalized image analysis tools (i.e Skimage and Scipy.NDimage in the Python environment, ImageJ, MatLab's Image Processing Toolbox), but the all require building up complex scripts or macros to accomplish tasks of specific use to porous media. The aim of PoreSpy is to provide a set of pre-written tools for all the common porous media measurements.
about.summary: A set of tools for characterizing and analying 3D images of porous materials
